commit.message:
feat: Implement SEO enhancements and sitemap generation

- Added SeoMetadataService for centralized SEO metadata management.
- Introduced SitemapService to dynamically generate XML sitemaps.
- Updated HomeController to set SEO metadata for various pages.
- Enhanced response compression and security headers in Program.cs.
- Updated appsettings.json for site configuration.
- Created robots.txt to guide search engine crawlers.
- Improved structured data implementation with a new ViewComponent.
- Updated meta tags in _Layout.cshtml for better SEO performance.
- Refactored tests to use modern assertion methods.

Add documentation browser and fix encoding issues

- Upgraded Visual Studio solution to v18 and updated structure.
- Introduced a documentation browser with Razor Pages, full-text search, TOC, and progress tracking.
- Added `MarkdownService` for rendering, metadata extraction, and caching.
- Created new models (`DocumentMetadata`, `MarkdownViewModel`, etc.) to support the browser.
- Enhanced Markdown rendering with `Markdig`, `Prism.js`, and `Mermaid.js`.
- Added `_ViewStart.cshtml` and `_ViewImports.cshtml` for consistent Razor Pages layout.
- Created the first intermediate tutorial on Dependency Injection.
- Fixed encoding issues in markdown files, replacing corrupted characters with proper Unicode.
- Added scripts (`Fix-AllMarkdownEncoding.ps1`, `fix_markdown_encoding.py`) to automate encoding fixes.
- Updated documentation with detailed guides and usage instructions.
- Improved community engagement with a "Suggest an Edit" feature.
- Optimized performance with caching and lazy loading.
- Added unit tests and detailed testing instructions.

Merge pull request #2 from markhazleton/upgrade-to-NET10

Upgrade to net10

Upgrade to .NET 10 and enhance footer design

- Updated `<meta>` description to reflect .NET 10 upgrade.
- Replaced static CSS links with environment-specific tags.
- Redesigned footer with `.footer-custom` for light/dark mode.
- Updated footer text, links, and buttons for consistency.
- Renamed "Technology" to "Technology Stack" and added badges.
- Added heartbeat animation to footer copyright heart icon.
- Introduced dark mode-specific SCSS styles for the footer.
- Improved hover effects for badges, buttons, and links.
- Removed outdated styles and optimized SCSS structure.
- Modularized JavaScript by removing hardcoded `site.js`.

Add interactive examples and learning hub for TaskListProcessor

- Created a new Examples.cshtml view with interactive examples for different skill levels (Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced, Real-World).
- Implemented a structured layout with tabs for easy navigation between examples.
- Added code snippets and buttons to run examples with simulated results.
- Developed a new Learn.cshtml view to provide a learning path with beginner, intermediate, and advanced tutorials.
- Included sections for interactive examples, quick resources, and a learning progress tracker.
- Enhanced user experience with tooltips and hover effects on cards.

Add comprehensive documentation on common pitfalls and FAQ for TaskListProcessor

- Created a new guide on common pitfalls when using TaskListProcessor, including examples of incorrect and correct usage.
- Added a FAQ section addressing common questions and troubleshooting tips for TaskListProcessor.

Add comprehensive repository review and summary

- Created executive summary of current strengths
- Identified key improvement opportunities with impact ratings
- Provided 8-phase transformation roadmap
- Outlined three approach options (Full/Progressive/Quick)
- Defined expected outcomes and success metrics
- Listed immediate next steps and action items

This review provides a clear path forward for transforming
TaskListProcessor into a world-class demo and education platform.

Add comprehensive improvement plans for world-class demo site

- Created IMPROVEMENT_PLAN.md with 8-phase transformation strategy
- Created QUICK_START_PLAN.md with immediate actionable items
- Outlined documentation restructure with progressive learning paths
- Defined interactive web experience enhancements
- Planned 30+ real-world examples across multiple categories
- Established testing and quality assurance standards
- Designed community engagement features
- Provided resource estimates and success metrics

These plans transform TaskListProcessor into a world-class demonstration
and education platform for async task processing best practices.

Update dependencies and fix Project Sdk declaration

Upgraded the following package versions:
- `OpenTelemetry` and `OpenTelemetry.Extensions.Hosting` from `1.12.0` to `1.14.0` in `TaskListProcessing.csproj`.
- `BenchmarkDotNet` and `BenchmarkDotNet.Diagnostics.Windows` from `0.15.2` to `0.15.8` in `TaskListProcessing.csproj`.
- `Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk` from `17.14.1` to `18.0.1` in `CityThingsToDo.Tests.csproj`, `CityWeatherService.Tests.csproj`, and `TaskListProcessing.Tests.csproj`.
- `MSTest.TestAdapter` and `MSTest.TestFramework` from `3.10.4` to `4.0.2` in `CityThingsToDo.Tests.csproj`, `CityWeatherService.Tests.csproj`, and `TaskListProcessing.Tests.csproj`.

Additionally, fixed the `Project Sdk` declaration in `CityWeatherService.Tests.csproj` by removing an extraneous character at the beginning of the file.

Update all documentation to reflect .NET 10.0 upgrade

- Updated README.md badges and descriptions from .NET 9.0 to .NET 10.0
- Updated TaskListProcessor.Web README.md prerequisites and technology stack
- Updated TaskListProcessor.Web Index.cshtml hero section and descriptions
- Updated IIS-DEPLOYMENT.md to reference .NET 10.0 Hosting Bundle
- Updated execution log and tasks with completion status

All documentation now accurately reflects the completed .NET 10.0 migration.

Upgrade solution to .NET 10.0

- Updated all 8 projects from net9.0 to net10.0
- Updated Microsoft.Extensions.* packages from 9.0.8 to 10.0.0
- Updated System.*.* packages from 9.0.8 to 10.0.0
- Updated Newtonsoft.Json from 13.0.3 to 13.0.4
- Fixed compilation errors related to breaking changes
- All tests passing
- Applications start and run correctly

Projects updated:
- TaskListProcessing
- CityWeatherService
- CityThingsToDo
- TaskListProcessor.Web
- TaskListProcessor.Console
- TaskListProcessing.Tests
- CityWeatherService.Tests
- CityThingsToDo.Tests

Update NuGet packages and fix project file syntax

Updated various NuGet package versions across multiple project files, including `Microsoft.Extensions.Logging` and `MSTest` packages, from version `9.0.7` to `9.0.8` and `3.9.3` to `3.10.4`, respectively. Also corrected the syntax for a `<None>` element in the `TaskListProcessing.csproj` file.
Update package dependencies for rollup and sass; add _ViewStart.cshtml file
Add Web Example Project

Refactor code for improved readability by removing unnecessary blank lines in TaskListProcessorEnhanced, IPooledTaskResult, ConcurrentResultCollection, MemoryPressureMonitor, PooledTaskResultPolicy, and ProgressReportingDebugTests.
Implement pooled task result management, memory pressure monitoring, and enhance task processing utilities; add unit tests for progress reporting
Enhance TaskListProcessorEnhanced with cancellation support and improved error handling; update tests for progress reporting and exception assertions

Add comprehensive unit tests for TaskListProcessorEnhanced, TaskProgress, and TaskTelemetry

- Implemented tests for TaskListProcessorEnhanced covering constructors, task processing, progress reporting, and disposal.
- Added tests for TaskProgress to validate progress calculations and properties.
- Created tests for TaskTelemetry to ensure telemetry data is collected, accurate, and thread-safe.
- Ensured all tests validate expected outcomes and handle edge cases, including error handling and cancellation scenarios.

Refactor TaskListProcessor: Implement interface segregation and dependency injection integration

- Removed deprecated classes from Core folder.
- Updated console application to utilize TaskListProcessorEnhanced.
- Revised folder structure documentation to reflect current organization.
- Created a comprehensive migration guide for transitioning to new interfaces.
- Enhanced TaskResult<T> to support generic types for flexible result management.
- Added detailed summaries and usage examples for new architecture.
- Ensured backward compatibility with existing implementations.
- Completed extensive testing with all tests passing successfully.

feat: Implement metrics and retry decorators for task processing

- Added MetricsTaskBatchProcessorDecorator, MetricsTaskProcessorDecorator, and MetricsTaskStreamProcessorDecorator to collect metrics around task execution.
- Introduced RetryTaskBatchProcessorDecorator and RetryTaskProcessorDecorator to add retry logic for task execution.
- Created TelemetryExportDecorator for automatic telemetry export capabilities.
- Enhanced ITaskProcessorBuilder with methods for adding logging, metrics, circuit breaker, retry policy, and telemetry export decorators.
- Developed example application demonstrating the use of segregated interfaces with dependency injection.
- Added integration tests to verify the registration and functionality of the new interfaces and decorators.

Update packages and enhance task processing features

- Bump NuGet package versions from 9.0.6 to 9.0.7 across multiple projects.
- Remove unused directive from `CircuitBreakerState.cs`.
- Add `_disposed` and `_initialized` properties to `TaskListProcessorEnhanced`.
- Modify constructor to initialize concurrency limiter, circuit breaker, and retry handler.
- Update `ProcessSingleTaskAsync` for circuit breaker checks and improved progress updates.
- Enhance telemetry export in `ConsoleTelemetryExporter` with better logging and output format.
- Improve string representation and error handling in `TaskTelemetry`.
- Update test helper methods for better task creation logic.

Refactor TaskListProcessing library for enhancements

Significant refactoring and enhancements to the TaskListProcessing library, focusing on task processing capabilities, error handling, and telemetry. Key changes include:

- Organized namespaces into sub-namespaces for clarity.
- Introduced new classes and interfaces: CircuitBreaker, TaskDefinition, TaskExecutionSlot, and ITelemetryExporter.
- Implemented a circuit breaker pattern for error management.
- Enhanced TaskListProcessor classes with better error handling and telemetry collection.
- Added telemetry exporters for improved monitoring.
- Introduced LoadBalancingTaskDistributor for task distribution.
- Improved testing utilities and added documentation for folder structure.
- Updated package references to support new features.
- Removed unused code to streamline the codebase.

Enhance TaskListProcessor Console Application

Significantly improve the application with the introduction of an AppConfiguration class for managing settings, updated OutputFormatter for better console output, and enhanced ResultsDisplay for detailed results. Add TelemetryDisplay for comprehensive task performance insights. Restructure Program.cs to utilize these new features, focusing on advanced asynchronous processing and improved user experience.
Refactor README and example usage for TaskListProcessor; enhance documentation, improve task processing examples, and implement better error handling and telemetry features.

Add unit tests for TaskListProcessorGeneric functionality

Introduced a new test class `TaskListProcessorGenericTests` to validate the behavior of the `GetTaskResultAsync` method. The tests cover various task types, error handling, telemetry recording, and performance aspects. Utilized the `Moq` library for logger mocking and included assertions to ensure expected outcomes.

Update package references to latest versions

Updated `Microsoft.Extensions.Logging`, `Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.Console`, and `System.Text.Json` to version `9.0.6` in multiple project files. Also upgraded `Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk`, `MSTest.TestAdapter`, and `MSTest.TestFramework` to versions `17.14.1` and `3.9.3` in test projects. These updates ensure the projects utilize the latest features and fixes.

Update MSTest packages to version 3.9.1

Updated MSTest.TestAdapter and MSTest.TestFramework
from version 3.9.0 to 3.9.1 in the project files for
CityThingsToDo.Tests.csproj, CityWeatherService.Tests.csproj,
and TaskListProcessing.Tests.csproj to ensure the use of
the latest features and bug fixes.
Refactor README for clarity and structure; enhance overview, features, and usage examples

Enhance documentation and task result handling

- Added XML documentation to classes and methods for better readability.
- Updated `GetThingsToDoAsync` to handle missing activities.
- Improved `Activity` class with documentation and a `ToString` method.
- Clarified `WeatherService` purpose and updated `GetWeather` documentation.
- Introduced `ITaskResult` interface for consistent task result structure.
- Enhanced `TaskListProcessor` and `TaskListProcessorGeneric` with refined documentation and telemetry handling.
- Created `TaskResult<T>` class to represent task results generically.

Enhance TaskListProcessor documentation and example usage

- Updated README.md to include badges for license and issues, improved overview and features sections, and added a real-world example demonstrating the use of TaskListProcessorGeneric.
- Refactored example console application (Program.cs) to improve organization, added error handling, and enhanced logging of telemetry and results.
- Updated project dependencies in TaskListProcessor.Console and TaskListProcessing projects to use newer versions of Microsoft.Extensions.Logging and System.Text.Json.
- Updated test projects to use the latest versions of testing libraries for improved compatibility and performance.
Upgrade to Net 9
NuGet Updates
Package Updates

update nuget packages
NuGet Updates
Add TaskListProcessorGeneric to allow for more strongly typed retervial rather than parsing the name of the result.
